div.stage: Lights up on Aaron Burr and the Company.

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: How does a bastard, orphan, son of a whore and a
Scotsman, dropped in the middle of a forgotten
Spot in the Caribbean by providence, impoverished, in squalor
Grow up to be a hero and a scholar?

sp.speaker: LAURENS

l.seg: The ten-dollar Founding Father without a father

sp.l: Got a lot farther by working a lot harder
By being a lot smarter
By being a self-starter

l.seg: By fourteen, they placed him in charge of a trading charter

sp.speaker: JEFFERSON
sp.l: And every day while slaves were being slaughtered and carted
Away across the waves, he struggled and kept his guard up
Inside, he was longing for something to be a part of
The brother was ready to beg, steal, borrow, or barter

sp.speaker: MADISON

l.seg: Then a hurricane came, and devastation reigned

sp.l: Our man saw his future drip, dripping down the drain
Put a pencil to his temple, connected it to his brain
And he wrote his first refrain, a testament to his pain

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: Well, the word got around, they said, “This kid is insane, man”

l.seg: Took up a collection just to send him to the mainland

sp.l: “Get your education, don’t forget from whence you came, and
The world's gonna know your name. What’s your name, man?”

sp.speaker: HAMILTON
sp.l: My name is Alexander Hamilton
And there’s a million things I haven’t done
But just you wait, just you wait...

sp.speaker: ELIZA

l.seg: When he was ten his father split, full of it, debt-ridden

sp.l: Two years later, see Alex and his mother bed-ridden
Half-dead sittin' in their own sick, the scent thick

sp.speaker: COMPANY
sp.l: And Alex got better but his mother went quick

sp.speaker: WASHINGTON

l.seg: Moved in with a cousin, the cousin committed suicide

sp.l: Left him with nothin’ but ruined pride, something new inside
A voice saying

sp.speaker: COMPANY
sp.l: “Alex, you gotta fend for yourself.”

sp.speaker: WASHINGTON
sp.l: He started retreatin’ and readin’ every treatise on the shelf

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: There would have been nothin’ left to do
For someone less astute
He woulda been dead or destitute
Without a cent of restitution

l.seg: Started workin’, clerkin’ for his late mother’s landlord

sp.l: Tradin’ sugar cane and rum and all the things he can’t afford

sp.speaker: COMPANY
sp.l: Scammin’

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: Scammin’ for every book he can get his hands on

sp.speaker: COMPANY
sp.l: Plannin’

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: Plannin’ for the future see him now as he stands on

sp.speaker: COMPANY
sp.l: Oooh...

sp.speaker: BURR

l.seg: The bow of a ship headed for a new land

sp.l: In New York you can be a new man

sp.speaker: COMPANY
sp.l: In New York you can
Be a new man—

sp.speaker: COMPANY
sp.l: In New York you can
Be a new man—

sp.speaker: COMPANY
sp.l: In New York you can be a new man—

sp.speaker: WOMEN
sp.l: In New York—

sp.speaker: MEN
sp.l: New York—

sp.speaker: COMPANY
sp.l: We are waiting in the wings for you
Waiting in the wings for you
You could never back down
You never learned to take your time!
Oh, Alexander Hamilton
Alexander Hamilton…
When America sings for you
America sings for you
Will they know what you overcame?
Will they know you rewrote the game?
The world will never be the same, oh

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: The ship is in the harbor now
See if you can spot him

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: Another immigrant
Comin’ up from the bottom

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: His enemies destroyed his rep
America forgot him

sp.speaker: MULLIGAN/LAFAYETTE
sp.l: We fought with him

sp.speaker: PHILIP
sp.l: Me? I died for him

sp.speaker: WASHINGTON
sp.l: Me? I trusted him

sp.speaker: ANGELICA/ELIZA/MARIA
sp.l: Me? I loved him

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: And me? I’m the damn fool that shot him

sp.speaker: COMPANY
sp.l: There’s a million things I haven’t done
But just you wait!

sp.speaker: BURR
sp.l: What’s your name, man?

sp.speaker: COMPANY
sp.l: Alexander Hamilton!

event.label: Alexander Hamilton's Birth
event.desc: Alexander Hamilton was born in Charlestown, St. Kitts and Nevis. There is a debate that he was born two years earlier in 1755, but 1757 matches closer to ages listed in the musical.

event.label: Hamilton's Father Left
event.desc: James Hamilton, Alexander Hamilton's father and a Scottish Laird, left Hamilton and his family, most likely due to the fact Alexander was his illegitimate son. This date is estimated from the song lyrics describing Alexander Hamilton as ten when his father left.

event.label: Hamilton's Mother Dies
event.desc: Rachel Faucette Buck, Hamilton's mother, died on February 19, 1768. After her death, Hamilton and his brother, James, moved to live with their cousin.

event.label: Hamilton In Charge of a Trading Charter
event.desc: The lyrics in "Alexander Hamilton" describe Hamilton being in charge of a trading charter when he was fourteen. This is an estimated date to show when he would be in this position.

event.label: Hurricane Maria Hits
event.desc: Hurricane Maria hit St.Croix, where Hamilton was currently working, in 1772.

event.label: Hamilton Writes Letter About Hurricane Maria
event.desc: Hamilton wrote a letter describing the storm to his father which gained the attention of the island's elite. The letter was how he "wrote his way out" and got to travel to New York.

event.label: Hamilton Arrives in New York
event.desc: Near the end of 1772, Alexander Hamilton arrives in New York City. The month and day are estimated based off other dates.
